g3103.definition: [Μαθουσάλα] of Hebrew origin ({{h4968}}); Mathusala (i.e. Methushelach), an antediluvian

g3104.definition: [Μαϊνάν] probably of Hebrew origin; Mainan, an Israelite

g3105.definition: [μαίνομαι] middle voice from a primary μάω (to long for; through the idea of insensate craving); to rave as a "maniac"

g3106.definition: [μακαρίζω] from {{g3107}}; to beatify, i.e. pronounce (or esteem) fortunate

g3107.definition: [μακάριος] a prolonged form of the poetical μάκαρ (meaning the same); supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off

g3108.definition: [μακαρισμός] from {{g3106}}; beatification, i.e. attribution of good fortune

g3109.definition: [Μακεδονία] from {{g3110}}; Macedonia, a region of Greece

g3110.definition: [Μακεδών] of uncertain derivation; a Macedon (Macedonian), i.e. inhabitant of Macedonia

g3111.definition: [μάκελλον] of Latin origin (macellum); a butcher's stall, meat market or provision-shop

g3112.definition: [μακράν] feminine accusative case singular of {{g3117}} ({{g3598}} being implied); at a distance (literally or figuratively)

g3113.definition: [μακρόθεν] adverb from {{g3117}}; from a distance or afar

g3114.definition: [μακροθυμέω] from the same as {{g3116}}; to be long-spirited, i.e. (objectively) forbearing or (subjectively) patient

g3115.definition: [μακροθυμία] from the same as {{g3116}}; longanimity, i.e. (objectively) forbearance or (subjectively) fortitude

g3116.definition: [μακροθυμώς] adverb of a compound of {{g3117}} and {{g2372}}; with long (enduring) temper, i.e. leniently

g3117.definition: [μακρός] from {{g3372}}; long (in place (distant) or time (neuter plural))

g3120.definition: [μαλακός] of uncertain affinity; soft, i.e. fine (clothing); figuratively, a catamite

g3121.definition: [Μαλελεήλ] of Hebrew origin ({{h4111}}); Maleleel (i.e. Mahalalel), an antediluvian

g3122.definition: [μάλιστα] neuter plural of the superlative of an apparently primary adverb μάλα (very); (adverbially) most (in the greatest degree) or particularly

g3123.definition: [μᾶλλον] neuter of the comparative of the same as {{g3122}}; (adverbially) more (in a greater degree)) or rather

g3124.definition: [Μάλχος] of Hebrew origin ({{h4429}}); Malchus, an Israelite

g3126.definition: [μαμμωνᾶς] of Chaldee origin (confidence, i.e. wealth, personified); mammonas, i.e. avarice (deified)

g3127.definition: [Μαναήν] of uncertain origin; Manaën, a Christian

g3128.definition: [Μανασσῆς] of Hebrew origin ({{h4519}}); Mannasses (i.e. Menashsheh), an Israelite

g3129.definition: [μανθάνω] prolongation from a primary verb, another form of which, μαθέω, is used as an alternate in certain tenses; to learn (in any way)

g3131.definition: [μάννα] of Hebrew origin ({{h4478}}); manna (i.e. man), an edible gum

g3132.definition: [μαντεύομαι] from a derivative of {{g3105}} (meaning a prophet, as supposed to rave through inspiration); to divine, i.e. utter spells (under pretense of foretelling

g3133.definition: [μαραίνω] of uncertain affinity; to extinguish (as fire), i.e. (figuratively and passively) to pass away

g3134.definition: [μαρὰν ἀθά] of Chaldee origin (meaning our Lord has come); maranatha, i.e. an exclamation of the approaching divine judgment

g3136.definition: [Μάρθα] probably of Chaldee origin (meaning mistress); Martha, a Christian woman

g3137.definition: [Μαρία]   or Μαριάμof Hebrew origin ({{h4813}}); Maria or Mariam (i.e. Mirjam), the name of six Christian females

g3138.definition: [Μάρκος] of Latin origin; Marcus, a Christian

g3139.definition: [μάρμαρος] from μαρμαίρω (to glisten); marble (as sparkling white)

g3140.definition: [μαρτυρέω] from {{g3144}}; to be a witness, i.e. testify (literally or figuratively)

g3141.definition: [μαρτυρία] from {{g3144}}; evidence given (judicially or genitive case)

g3142.definition: [μαρτύριον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g3144}}; something evidential, i.e. (genitive case) evidence given or (specially), the Decalogue (in the sacred Tabernacle)

g3143.definition: [μαρτύρομαι] middle voice from {{g3144}}; to be adduced as a witness, i.e. (figuratively) to obtest (in affirmation or exhortation)

g3144.definition: [μάρτυς] of uncertain affinity; a witness (literally (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case)); by analogy, a "martyr"

g3145.definition: [μασσάομαι] from a primary μάσσω (to handle or squeeze); to chew

g3148.definition: [μάστιξ] probably from the base of {{g3145}} (through the idea of contact); a whip (literally, the Roman flagellum for criminals; figuratively, a disease)

g3149.definition: [μαστός] from the base of {{g3145}}; a (properly, female) breast (as if kneaded up)

g3151.definition: [ματαιολόγος] from {{g3152}} and {{g3004}}; an idle (i.e. senseless or mischievous) talker, i.e. a wrangler

g3152.definition: [μάταιος] from the base of {{g3155}}; empty, i.e. (literally) profitless, or (specially), an idol

g3153.definition: [ματαιότης] from {{g3152}}; inutility; figuratively, transientness; morally, depravity

g3154.definition: [ματαιόω] from {{g3152}}; to render (passively, become) foolish, i.e. (morally) wicked or (specially), idolatrous

g3155.definition: [μάτην] accusative case of a derivative of the base of {{g3145}} (through the idea of tentative manipulation, i.e. unsuccessful search, or else of punishment); folly, i.e. (adverbially) to no purpose

g3156.definition: [Ματθαῖος] a shorter form of {{g3161}}; Matthæus (i.e. Matthitjah), an Israelite and a Christian

g3157.definition: [Ματθάν] of Hebrew origin ({{h4977}}); Matthan (i.e. Mattan), an Israelite

g3158.definition: [Ματθάτ] probably a shortened form of {{g3161}}; Matthat (i.e. Mattithjah), the name of two Israelites

g3159.definition: [Ματθίας] apparently a shortened form of {{g3161}}; Matthias (i.e. Mattithjah), an Israelite

g3160.definition: [Ματταθά] probably a shortened form of {{g3161}} (compare {{h4992}}); Mattatha (i.e. Mattithjah), an Israelite

g3161.definition: [Ματταθίας] of Hebrew origin ({{h4993}}); Mattathias (i.e. Mattithjah), an Israelite and a Christian

g3162.definition: [μάχαιρα] probably feminine of a presumed derivative of {{g3163}}; a knife, i.e. dirk; figuratively, war, judicial punishment

g3164.definition: [μάχομαι] middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to war, i.e. (figuratively) to quarrel, dispute

g3165.definition: [μέ] a shorter (and probably original) form of {{g1691}}; me

g3166.definition: [μεγαλαυχέω] from a compound of {{g3173}} and αὐχέω (to boast; akin to {{g837}} and {{g2744}}); to talk big, i.e. be grandiloquent (arrogant, egotistic)

g3167.definition: [μεγαλεῖος] from {{g3173}}; magnificent, i.e. (neuter, plural as noun) a conspicuous favor, or (subjectively) perfection

g3168.definition: [μεγαλειότης] from {{g3167}}; superbness, i.e. glory or splendor

g3169.definition: [μεγαλοπρεπής] from {{g3173}} and {{g4241}}; befitting greatness or magnificence (majestic)

g3170.definition: [μεγαλύνω] from {{g3173}}; to make (or declare) great, i.e. increase or (figuratively) extol

g3172.definition: [μεγαλωσύνη] from {{g3173}}; greatness, i.e. (figuratively) divinity (often God himself)

g3173.definition: [μέγας] (including the prolonged forms, feminine μεγάλη, plural μεγάλοι, etc.; compare also {{g3176}}, {{g3187}}); big (literally or figuratively, in a very wide application)

g3176.definition: [μέγιστος] superlative of {{g3173}}; greatest or very great

g3177.definition: [μεθερμηνεύω] from {{g3326}} and {{g2059}}; to explain over, i.e. translate

g3178.definition: [μέθη] apparently a primary word; an intoxicant, i.e. (by implication) intoxication

g3179.definition: [μεθίστημι] , or (1 Cor. 13:2)      μεθιστάνωfrom {{g3326}} and {{g2476}}; to transfer, i.e. carry away, depose or (figuratively) exchange, seduce

g3180.definition: [μεθοδεία] from a compound of {{g3326}} and {{g3593}} (compare "method"); travelling over, i.e. travesty (trickery)

g3181.definition: [μεθόριος] from {{g3326}} and {{g3725}}; bounded alongside, i.e. contiguous (neuter plural as noun, frontier)

g3182.definition: [μεθύσκω] a prolonged (transitive) form of {{g3184}}; to intoxicate

g3183.definition: [μέθυσος] from {{g3184}}; tipsy, i.e. (as noun) a sot

g3184.definition: [μεθύω] from another form of {{g3178}}; to drink to intoxication, i.e. get drunk

g3187.definition: [μείζων] irregular comparative of {{g3173}}; larger (literally or figuratively, specially, in age)

g3190.definition: [Μελεᾶς] of uncertain origin; Meleas, an Israelite

g3191.definition: [μελετάω] from a presumed derivative of {{g3199}}; to take care of, i.e. (by implication) revolve in the mind

g3193.definition: [μελίσσιος] from {{g3192}}; relating to honey, i.e. bee (comb)

g3194.definition: [Μελίτη] of uncertain origin; Melita, an island in the Mediterranean

g3195.definition: [μέλλω] a strengthened form of {{g3199}} (through the idea of expectation); to intend, i.e. be about to be, do, or suffer something (of persons or things, especially events; in the sense of purpose, duty, necessity, probability, possibility, or hesitation)

g3196.definition: [μέλος] of uncertain affinity; a limb or part of the body

g3197.definition: [Μελχί] of Hebrew origin ({{h4428}} with pronominal suffix, my king); Melchi (i.e. Malki), the name of two Israelites

g3198.definition: [Μελχισεδέκ] of Hebrew origin ({{h4442}}); Melchisedek (i.e. Malkitsedek), a patriarch

g3199.definition: [μέλω] a primary verb; to be of interest to, i.e. to concern (only third person singular present indicative used impersonally, it matters)
